So said  malla6um  on  2002-10-24 

>Since I am new to unittesting, I think this will be an ideal platform 
>to put my questions.
>

>1) How should unit testing be done for a web application development?

Push as much logic out of the web container as possible. Make your
servlets, JSPs, whatever, as thin as possible. Have them delegate to
plain old Java objects which you can test normally and outside the web
container.

For end-to-end testing through the browser, consider HTMLUnit.

>2) What different options, other than junit, do I have if I want to 
>do:
>a) Unit Testing
>b) Functional Testing

You can roll your own. You can buy a big tool. A Google Search and 30
minutes of your time will answer this question.

>3) what are the weaknesses of junit? How can they be resolved?

The weaknesses are different from person to person. You can easy
resolve them by extending JUnit to meet your particular needs. This was
an aspect of its design: if all you need to do is add one more feature
to make JUnit work for you, then Kent is happy.
